name: Le Rossignol Correspondence
allMetadata: The Le Rossignol correspondence consists of 45 letters written from Arthur Stanley Le Rossignol to his sister, Constance Ethel, from his position on the Western Front during World War I. There are additional letters written by Arthur (5), Ethel's colleague Pierre Pulinekse (4), Ethel herself to her Aunt Anna Le Rossignol (4), and others. The bulk of correspondence took place in 1918. The letters cover topics of cultural interest, such as British-German animosity and perceptions of the war. Most of Arthur's letters are vague and do not reveal his location or the details of military operations. His correspondence covers the period 1914-1919. All together, there are 52 letters, 42 envelopes, 14 post cards, a photograph album, a telegram, a copy of strategic battle plans, a pamphlet, and other miscellaneous items. 1914-1919 Le Rossignol, Arthur Stanley, 1875-? (Person) English https://archivesspace.library.nd.edu/repositories/3/resources/1392
creator: Le Rossignol, Arthur Stanley, 1875-? (Person)

name: Abel Blanchard Family Correspondence
allMetadata: A group of around 50 manuscripts retained by the Abel Blanchard family of Peacham, Vermont. Most are personal letters dating from the 1810s and 20s, written to Vermont by family members newly migrated to Canada or western New York state. Blanchard, Benjamin, 1786-1869 Rare Books and Special Collections, Hesburgh Libraries, University of Notre Dame.
creator: Blanchard, Benjamin, 1786-1869
credit line: Rare Books and Special Collections, Hesburgh Libraries, University of Notre Dame.

name: Nathaniel Rogers Semon Notebook
allMetadata: A journal of sermon notes compiled by the Puritan divine Nathaniel Rogers (1598-1655), before and after his emigration from England to Massachusetts in 1636. The volume contains notes for at least 19 sermons audited by Rogers, and more than 100 composed by him. Rogers,'Nathaniel,'1598-1655. MSN/COL 9405,'Nathaniel'Rogers'Sermon'Notebook, Rare Books & Special Collections, Hesburgh Libraries, University of Notre Dame.
creator: Rogers,'Nathaniel,'1598-1655.
credit line: MSN/COL 9405,'Nathaniel'Rogers'Sermon'Notebook, Rare Books & Special Collections, Hesburgh Libraries, University of Notre Dame.

name: ABSOLUTION UNDER FIRE
allMetadata: TEST While Paul Wood was sketching Fr. Corby, Edwards asked Corby if he wore a cassock during the absolution, to which Corby replied: "I do not remember whether I unloosened it or not, as there was no time for preparation, all I recollect is that in my hurry I placed around my neck a small purple stole, which I usually carried in a pocket." TEST Wood, Paul Henry 1891 76 1/2 x 102 x 3 1/4 in. (194.31 x 259.08 x 8.26 cm) Galleries American Art Gift of the artist absolution
